description: A federal bankruptcy judge has ruled that a plan to sell off the assets of Jones' media company, Free Speech Systems, can move ahead. Net proceeds will go to the Sandy Hook families who Jones defamed.
title: Going once … going twice: Alex Jones’ cameras, mics, Infowars show, vitamin site

description: Former President Donald Trump called for a "manufacturing renaissance" in a Savannah, Ga. speech on Tuesday, proposing measures some economists say would raise prices on Americans.
title: Trump vows to 'steal' jobs from other countries in winding speech on economic plans

description: The poll from the Harvard Kennedy School's Institute of Politics shows Harris well ahead among likely voters 18 to 29. It’s a promising sign for Harris, who is banking on high levels of youth support.
title: A new poll of young voters shows Harris with a commanding 31 point lead over Trump

description: Arkansas unveiled a new statue of Johnny Cash in the U.S. Capitol. Cash, the first musician to be honored in the building, replaces a statue of a Confederate general.
title: US Capitol statue of Johnny Cash depicts Arkansas' history and progress

description:
In Russia, polls consistently show support for the war in Ukraine somewhere around 70%. But a recent independent study of Russians' opinions indicates the picture is more complex. We hear more from our correspondent in Moscow.

And in Ukraine, couples who are separated by the war can now propose and get married online over an app. The service is so popular there is a months-long wait for virtual ceremonies.
title: How Do Russians Really Feel About the War in Ukraine?

description: The Justice Department sued Visa today, accusing the giant payments company of seeking to monopolize the debit card business.
title: Justice Department accuses Visa of stifling competition in the debit card business

description: Tropical Storm Helene's trajectory threatens the Florida panhandle, which forecasters say could be hit on Thursday. Meteorologists say this system will be particularly big -- with a wide wind field.
title: Tropical Storm Helene threatens the U.S., Mexico

description: President Biden talked about the sweeping changes he has seen during his long career, urged an end to wars in Ukraine, Gaza and Sudan, and said "some things are more important than staying in power."
title: Biden pledges mpox aid to Africa in his valedictory speech to the United Nations

description: Favre, 54, revealed the diagnosis while testifying before a U.S. House committee about his role in a controversy over millions of dollars of misspent welfare funds in his home state of Mississippi.
title: Retired NFL Hall of Fame quarterback Brett Favre reveals he has Parkinson's disease

description: Mueller deputy Aaron Zebley looks back on the investigation of Trump's ties to Russia and explains why his team didn’t indict the president in 2017. Zebley is the co-author of Interference.
title: Mueller investigator says Russia interfered in 2016 -- and in the 2024 election too

description: Harris said that as president she would support eliminating the filibuster in the U.S. Senate to bring back federal protections for a woman's right to an abortion.
title: Harris says she would support ending the filibuster to bring back Roe v. Wade

description: Dozens of advocates are blanketing Capitol Hill this week to continue their push for Congress to revive a program that provided compensation for people suffering long-standing impacts from US nuclear testing programs.
title: Push for compensation for U.S. nuclear testing fallout resumes on Capitol Hill

description: Luis Armando Albino was lured away from a California park at the age of 6. He reunited with his biological family this summer after his niece found him through DNA testing and newspaper clippings.
title: A boy snatched from a California park in 1951 is found living on the East Coast

description: Donald Trump has spent the last several months speaking with popular male influencers and podcasters like Logan Paul and Theo Von. The appearances are part of a strategy to turn out young men.
title: How Trump and Vance's tour of dude influencers might help them win

description: California is suing ExxonMobil for allegedly misleading the public for decades about the recyclability of plastic. And, Israeli strikes in Lebanon yesterday left nearly 500 people dead.
title: ExxonMobil sued over plastic pollution. And, nearly 500 killed in Israeli strikes

description: Once the high priests of policy, economists may now be seeing lower demand. But who's taking their place?
title: Have economists gone out of fashion in Washington?

description: New York City has a well known rat problem. And the city is trying to tackle it — with trash cans and by changing human behavior.
title: New York City has a rat problem. Officials have a plan to kick it from the curb

description: Police produce way too many body camera videos for humans to review. Enter the AI's
title: Human reviewers can't keep up with all the police body cam videos. Now they're giving the job to AI

description: Some companies are trying something new: Instead of offering a group health insurance plan, they're giving workers a contribution to buy their own individual plans.
title: A new approach to employer health care? Give workers money to buy their own plan

description: The trade of cross-border missiles came after the deadliest day of conflict in Lebanon since 2006.
title: Israel and Hezbollah continue to trade fire as residents in Lebanon look for safety

description: Voters in a record number of states — including the battlegrounds of Arizona and Nevada — are set to decide this fall whether to enact far-reaching changes to how their elections are run.
title: Voters in a number of states could upend how their elections are run

description: A festival and rodeo in Pahrump, Nevada, offers a glimpse into rural voters in the battleground state and how they could impact the election.
title: MAGA hats, a rodeo, and carnival games: What we saw at a festival west of Las Vegas

description: After Megan Atherton was evicted from her home, her car broke down. She had a long drive ahead and nowhere to go, until a kind stranger stepped in.
title: Megan's life was falling apart. Then a kind stranger swooped in to help

description: Southwest Airlines is expected to say more this week about its major change to assigned seats. It’s part of a larger shift across the industry to maximize revenue, even if it makes boarding slower.
title: Southwest is changing how it boards planes, but don’t expect it to be faster
